intro: Hydrostachys insignis, commonly known as the Cape mountain zizyphus, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Hydrostachys insignis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
